description: Airtable merges spreadsheet functionality with database power, enabling teams to organize projects, track tasks, and collaborate through customizable views, automation, and integrations for data management

tools.name: AIRTABLE_CREATE_BASE
tools.description: Creates a new Airtable base with specified tables and fields within a workspace.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name for the new Airtable base, visible in the UI.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the table, unique within the base.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Field configurations defining table columns; each needs a name and a valid Airtable field type. The first field cannot be 'singleSelect' as it becomes the primary field. Field types 'formula', 'rollup', 'count', 'lookup', 'multipleLookupValues', 'autoNumber', 'createdTime', and 'lastModifiedTime' are not supported at base creation. For 'singleSelect' and 'multipleSelects' fields, 'choices' array must include objects with both 'id' and 'name' for each choice.

tables.title: Tables

examples.name: Apartments
examples.description: A to-do list of places to visit

tables.description: Configurations for tables to be created in the new base; each table needs 'name' and 'fields'. Must be an array of table objects, not a stringified JSON. The first field in each table cannot be 'singleSelect' as it becomes the primary field. Select field choices must include both 'id' and 'name' for each choice. Field types 'formula', 'rollup', 'count', 'lookup', 'multipleLookupValues', 'autoNumber', 'createdTime', and 'lastModifiedTime' are not supported at base creation.

workspaceId.title: Workspace Id
workspaceId.description: Unique ID of the Airtable workspace (e.g., 'wspXXXXXXXXXXXXXX') for base creation.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_CREATE_COMMENT
tools.description: Creates a new comment on a specific record within an Airtable base and table.

text.title: Text
text.description: The content of the comment. To mention a user, use the format @[userId] (e.g., @[usrGISFlfA7l5F7kY6]).

baseId.title: Base Id
baseId.description: The unique identifier of the Airtable base. This typically starts with 'app'.

recordId.title: Record Id
recordId.description: The unique identifier of the record on which the comment will be created. This typically starts with 'rec'.

tableIdOrName.title: Table Id Or Name
tableIdOrName.description: The unique identifier (typically starting with 'tbl') or the name of the table within the base.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_CREATE_FIELD
tools.description: Creates a new field within a specified table in an Airtable base.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name for the new field. Field names must be unique within a table.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type for the new field. If not provided, it defaults to 'singleLineText'. Types that can be created via API: 'singleLineText', 'multilineText', 'richText', 'singleSelect', 'multipleSelects', 'checkbox', 'number', 'percent', 'currency', 'date', 'dateTime', 'duration', 'phoneNumber', 'email', 'url', 'attachment', 'barcode', 'rating', 'button', 'createdBy', 'lastModifiedBy', 'externalSyncSource'. Cannot be created via API: 'formula', 'rollup', 'count', 'lookup', 'multipleLookupValues', 'autoNumber', 'createdTime', 'lastModifiedTime'.

baseId.title: Base Id
baseId.description: The unique identifier of the base where the field will be created.

options.title: Options
options.description: Type-specific configuration for the new field. Required for types: 'number', 'percent' (requires 'precision'), 'currency' (requires 'precision' and 'symbol'), 'checkbox' (requires 'color' and 'icon'), 'date' (requires 'dateFormat'), 'dateTime' (requires 'dateFormat', 'timeFormat', and 'timeZone'), 'rating' (requires 'color' and 'icon'). For 'singleSelect' and 'multipleSelects', 'choices' array must include objects with both 'id' and 'name' for each choice.

tableId.title: Table Id
tableId.description: The unique identifier of the table within the base where the field will be created.

description.title: Description
examples: Tracks the current status of a task.
description.description: An optional description for the new field. This can provide context or instructions for the field's usage.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_CREATE_MULTIPLE_RECORDS
tools.description: Creates multiple new records in a specified Airtable table.

records.title: Records
examples: [{"fields": {"Address": "333 Post St", "Name": "Union Square", "Visited": "true"}}, {"fields": {"Address": "1 Ferry Building", "Name": "Ferry Building"}}]
records.description: List of new records, typically up to 10 per request. Each record object must have a `fields` key, mapping case-sensitive field names to values that align with Airtable field data types.

tableIdOrName.title: Table Id Or Name
tableIdOrName.description: Identifier or name of the table for record creation.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_CREATE_RECORD
tools.description: Creates a new record in a specified Airtable table; field values must conform to the table's column types.

baseId.title: Base Id
baseId.description: The unique identifier of the Airtable base.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: A dictionary of field names (or IDs) and their values for the new record. Ensure values conform to the target table's field types.

tableIdOrName.title: Table Id Or Name
tableIdOrName.description: The unique identifier or name of the table.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_CREATE_TABLE
tools.description: Creates a new table within a specified existing Airtable base, allowing definition of its name, description, and field structure.

name.title: Name
name.description: The desired name for the new table.

baseId.title: Base Id
baseId.description: The unique identifier of the base where the new table will be created.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: A list of field configurations for the new table. Each configuration defines a column and must include a 'name' (string) and 'type' (string). Note: The first field cannot be 'singleSelect' as it becomes the primary field. Field types 'formula', 'rollup', 'count', 'lookup', 'multipleLookupValues', 'autoNumber', 'createdTime', and 'lastModifiedTime' are not supported for table creation. Some field types require an 'options' object: 'number'/'percent' (precision), 'currency' (precision, symbol), 'checkbox' (color, icon), 'date' (dateFormat), 'dateTime' (dateFormat, timeFormat, timeZone), 'rating' (color, icon). For 'singleSelect' and 'multipleSelects', 'choices' must include objects with both 'id' and 'name'.

description.title: Description
examples: A table to track all ongoing projects.
description.description: An optional textual description for the new table.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_DELETE_COMMENT
tools.description: Deletes an existing comment from a specified record in an Airtable table.

baseId.title: Base Id
baseId.description: The unique identifier of the Airtable base from which the comment will be deleted.

recordId.title: Record Id
recordId.description: The unique identifier of the record within the specified table from which the comment will be deleted.

rowCommentId.title: Row Comment Id
rowCommentId.description: The unique identifier of the comment to be deleted from the specified record.

tableIdOrName.title: Table Id Or Name
tableIdOrName.description: The unique identifier (ID) or name of the table within the specified base that contains the record and comment.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_DELETE_MULTIPLE_RECORDS
tools.description: Deletes up to 10 specified records from a table within an Airtable base.

baseId.title: Base Id
baseId.description: The unique identifier of the Airtable base containing the records to be deleted.

recordIds.title: Record Ids
recordIds.description: A list of unique identifiers for the records to be deleted.

tableIdOrName.title: Table Id Or Name
tableIdOrName.description: The unique identifier (e.g., 'tbluIzIsxPIM2V3Y4') or the name (e.g., 'Marketing Leads') of the table within the base from which records will be deleted.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_DELETE_RECORD
tools.description: Permanently deletes a specific record from an existing table within an existing Airtable base.

baseId.title: Base Id
baseId.description: Unique identifier of the Airtable base, typically starting with 'app'.

recordId.title: Record Id
recordId.description: Unique identifier of the record to be deleted, typically starting with 'rec'.

tableIdOrName.title: Table Id Or Name
tableIdOrName.description: Unique identifier (typically starting with 'tbl') or name of the table within the specified base.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_GET_BASE_SCHEMA
tools.description: Retrieves the detailed schema for a specified Airtable base, including its tables, fields, field types, and configurations, using the `baseId`.

baseId.title: Base Id
baseId.description: The unique identifier for the Airtable base. This ID typically starts with 'app' and is followed by a string of alphanumeric characters. It can be found in the URL when viewing the base.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_GET_RECORD
tools.description: Retrieves a specific record from a table within an Airtable base.

recordId.title: Record Id
recordId.description: ID of the record to retrieve.

cellFormat.title: Cell Format
cellFormat.description: Controls cell value formatting: 'json' for native types, 'string' for all values as strings.

tableIdOrName.title: Table Id Or Name
tableIdOrName.description: ID or name of the table.

returnFieldsByFieldId.title: Return Fields By Field Id
returnFieldsByFieldId.description: If true, field keys in the response are field IDs; otherwise, field names.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_GET_USER_INFO
tools.description: Retrieves information, such as ID and permission scopes, for the currently authenticated Airtable user from the `/meta/whoami` endpoint.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_LIST_BASES
tools.description: Retrieves all Airtable bases accessible to the authenticated user, which may include an 'offset' for pagination.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_LIST_COMMENTS
tools.description: Retrieves all comments for a specific record in an Airtable table, requiring existing `baseId`, `tableIdOrName`, and `recordId`.

baseId.title: Base Id
baseId.description: The unique identifier of the Airtable base from which to list comments.

recordId.title: Record Id
recordId.description: The unique identifier of the record for which comments are to be listed.

tableIdOrName.title: Table Id Or Name
tableIdOrName.description: The unique identifier or name of the table within the specified base containing the record.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_LIST_RECORDS
tools.description: Retrieves records from an Airtable table, with options for filtering, sorting, pagination, and specifying returned fields. Common 422 Errors and Solutions: - INVALID_FILTER_BY_FORMULA: Check field names are case-sensitive and enclosed in {}. Escape single quotes by doubling them (''). - UNKNOWN_FIELD_NAME: Verify field names exist in the table. Use Get Base Schema action to discover correct field names. Best Practices: 1. Always verify field names using Get Base Schema before using them in filters or field lists 2. Test formulas in Airtable's web interface before using them in API calls 3. Use table IDs instead of names when possible for better reliability

field.title: Field
field.description: The name or ID of the field to sort by.

direction.title: Direction
direction.description: The direction for sorting. Defaults to 'desc'.

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: A list of sort objects to apply to the records. Records are sorted by the first sort object, then by the second, and so on. If not specified, records are returned in the order they appear in the table or view.

view.title: View
view.description: The name or ID of an existing view in the table. If specified, records will be returned according to the sort order and filters of this view.

baseId.title: Base Id
baseId.description: The ID of the Airtable base. Must start with 'app' followed by 14 characters.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: An array of field names or IDs to include in the response. If empty, all fields are returned. IMPORTANT: Field names are case-sensitive and must match exactly as they appear in Airtable. Use Get Base Schema action to discover correct field names. Cannot be used with `returnFieldsByFieldId` when that is true.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: The opaque offset for pagination, used to retrieve the next page of records. This value is provided in the previous response.

pageSize.title: Page Size
pageSize.description: The number of records to return per page. Must be between 1 and 100, inclusive. Defaults to 100.

timeZone.title: Time Zone
timeZone.description: The time zone to use for formatting date and time fields. Defaults to UTC. This affects how formulas like CREATED_TIME() are computed.

cellFormat.title: Cell Format
cellFormat.description: Specifies how cell values are returned. 'json' returns rich structured JSON values, while 'string' returns simple string representations. Defaults to 'json'.

maxRecords.title: Max Records
maxRecords.description: The maximum total number of records to return. If not specified, all records matching the query will be returned, up to Airtable's limits.

userLocale.title: User Locale
userLocale.description: The user locale to use for formatting cell values. For example, 'en-US' or 'fr-FR'. This affects how values like dates and numbers are displayed. This field is required when `cellFormat` is set to 'string'.

tableIdOrName.title: Table Id Or Name
tableIdOrName.description: The ID or name of the table within the base. Table IDs start with 'tbl' followed by 14 characters. Table names are case-sensitive and must match exactly as they appear in Airtable.

recordMetadata.title: Record Metadata
recordMetadata.description: An array of strings specifying which record metadata to include. Currently, the only supported value is 'commentCount'.

filterByFormula.title: Filter By Formula
filterByFormula.description: A formula used to filter records. The formula follows Airtable's formula syntax. IMPORTANT: Field names are case-sensitive and must be enclosed in curly braces {}. Single quotes within text values must be escaped by doubling them (''). Test formulas in Airtable's web interface first to ensure correct syntax.

returnFieldsByFieldId.title: Return Fields By Field Id
returnFieldsByFieldId.description: If true, field names in the response will be field IDs instead of field names. This is useful if you need stable field identifiers, as field names can change.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_UPDATE_MULTIPLE_RECORDS
tools.description: Updates multiple existing records in a specified Airtable table; these updates are not performed atomically.

baseId.title: Base Id
baseId.description: The ID of the Airtable base containing the table.

id.title: Id
id.description: The unique identifier of the record to be updated in Airtable.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: A dictionary where keys are field names (or field IDs) and values are the new content for those fields.

records.title: Records
records.description: List of records to be updated. A maximum of 10 records can be updated per request.

tableIdOrName.title: Table Id Or Name
tableIdOrName.description: The ID or name of the table within the base where records will be updated.

tools.name: AIRTABLE_UPDATE_RECORD
tools.description: Modifies specified fields of an existing record in an Airtable base and table; the base, table, and record must exist.

baseId.title: Base Id
baseId.description: The unique identifier of the Airtable base containing the record to be updated.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Specifies fields to update. Keys are field names or IDs; values are new content. Only included fields are modified; others remain unchanged.

recordId.title: Record Id
recordId.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the record to be updated within the specified table.

tableIdOrName.title: Table Id Or Name
tableIdOrName.description: The unique identifier (ID) or the name of the table within the base that contains the record to be updated.

returnFieldsByFieldId.title: Return Fields By Field Id
returnFieldsByFieldId.description: If `True`, API response keys record fields by field ID instead of name. Using field IDs is recommended for integrations resilient to field name changes.
